How a small AIS check can save you from a tax noticeIf you skip checking your AIS, you might end up missing some income details. This can lead to a mismatch between what you file and what the tax department already knows, and that can easily get you a notice later.

Why Tesla's ride into India's EV market won't be a smooth oneTesla's entry comes at a time when it is facing its biggest drop in global sales to date. Its domestic sales in the US fell 6.3% in the second quarter of 2025, the third straight quarterly decline.

From Rana as 'Baahubali's' Bhallaladeva to Bobby Deol in 'Animal', these roles are now stylish, powerful, and central to the story. During firefighting operations, bundles of cash were found in March, prompting an inquiry.

In India, China inching closer, a Trump role he won't brag aboutThe deep chill in India-China ties seems to be over with Beijing welcoming Moscow's proposal for a tri-nation bloc. Though India and China are natural competitors, it is a realisation brought about by US President Trump's brazenness, Washington's slant during the Indo-Pak mini-war, and a mutual need that is making the two shake hands, albeit with Op Sindoor awareness.

Live: Another rocky start, both Houses witness Opposition sloganeeringParliament Session 2025 Live Updates: The third day of the ongoing Monsoon Session of Parliament will resume at 11 am today and Opposition parties are most likely to intensify their demand for discussions on the Pahalgam terror attack and voter-roll revision in Bihar. On Tuesday, repeated protests by opposition MPs over the same issues brought both Houses to a standstill, stalling proceedings in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha for the second consecutive day. In the Lok Sabha, opposition leaders stormed the Well at 11 am, waving placards and shouting slogans to press for the withdrawal of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls in Bihar. Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan urged them to let the Question Hour proceed, but his plea went unheeded, forcing Speaker Om Birla to adjourn the House till noon. Each time the Lower House reassembled, similar disruptions erupted. The Rajya Sabha also witnessed multiple adjournments following uproar over the two prime issues and was ultimately adjourned for the day shortly after it met post-lunch at 2 pm without conducting any business. Follow indiatoday.in for all Live Updates.
